author: cnbc.com
title: George Gallate Joins Elite SEM Board of Directors to Advise Agency's Accelerated Growth
text:
NEW YORK, March 7, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- George Gallate, previously Global CEO and Global Chairman of Havas Digital, has joined the Board of Directors of Elite SEM, an award-winning performance-driven digital marketing agency.
Gallate is deeply respected in the agency space, having spent 27 years at Havas, where he established one of the first digital networks in the advertising industry. He pioneered its global expansion, with the agency being recognized as the largest digital network globally from 2003 to 2008. Gallate then served as CEO of RKG, the Rimm Kaufman Group, leading its sale to Merkle in 2014, where he became CMO and was awarded the American Business Awards' Grand Stevie for his marketing leadership success.
Now principal of MKTG2.U, a communications and social media consultancy serving CMOs and agencies, Gallate joins the Elite SEM Board of Directors to work closely with the leadership team as they serve enterprise CMOs with integrated media strategies that drive exponential growth and ROI. He will also lend his expertise in capitalizing on the rapidly changing digital ecosystem as the convergence of search, social, and digital marketplaces continues to grow.
Elite SEM is a performance-driven digital marketing agency known for its award-winning culture and client performance, with seven offices and a growing remote workforce across the U.S.
Elite SEM's unique business model ties account performance to account managers and rewards teams for continuous performance and client satisfaction with a share of company profits. This approach has led to an unprecedented 94% employee and client retention rate and has contributed to over 25% growth from 2016 to 2017.
In February 2017, Elite SEM announced its partnership with Mountaingate Capital to accelerate growth and expand and strengthen its core performance marketing services including Paid Search, Paid Social, Shopping & Feed, Performance Display, Amazon & Marketplaces, SEO, CRO, and Analytics.
